title: On Existence of Berk-Nash Equilibria in Misspecified Markov Decision Processes with Infinite Spaces. (arXiv:2206.08437v3 [econ.TH] UPDATED)
abstract: Model misspecification is a critical issue in many areas of theoretical and empirical economics. In the specific context of misspecified Markov Decision Processes, Esponda and Pouzo (2021) defined the notion of Berk-Nash equilibrium and established its existence in the setting of finite state and action spaces. However, many substantive applications (including two of the three motivating examples presented by Esponda and Pouzo, as well as Gaussian and log-normal distributions, and CARA, CRRA and mean-variance preferences) involve continuous state or action spaces, and are thus not covered by the Esponda-Pouzo existence theorem. We extend the existence of Berk-Nash equilibrium to compact action spaces and sigma-compact state spaces, with possibly unbounded payoff functions. A complication arises because the Berk-Nash equilibrium notion depends critically on Radon-Nikodym derivatives, which are necessarily bounded in the finite case but typically unbounded in misspecified continuous mode

translated_title: 在误指定的马尔可夫决策过程中存在Berk-Nash均衡的问题
translated_abstract: 模型误指定是理论和实证经济学中的一个重要问题。在误指定的马尔可夫决策过程的具体背景下，Esponda和Pouzo (2021)定义了Berk-Nash均衡的概念，并在有限状态和行动空间的设置中建立了其存在性。然而，许多实际应用（包括Esponda和Pouzo提出的三个激励示例中的两个，以及高斯和对数正态分布，和CARA，CRRA和均值方差偏好）涉及连续状态或行动空间，因此不适用于Esponda-Pouzo的存在定理。我们将Berk-Nash均衡的存在性推广到紧致行动空间和sigma-紧致态空间，可能存在无界收益函数的情况。这引发了一个复杂性问题，因为Berk-Nash均衡概念严重依赖Radon-Nikodym导数，在有限情况下必然有界，但在误指定的连续模式下通常是无界的。
tldr: 该论文讨论了在误指定的马尔可夫决策过程中存在Berk-Nash均衡的问题，并将其推广到具有紧致行动空间和sigma-紧致态空间的情况，解决了Esponda-Pouzo存在定理不适用的连续状态或行动空间的情况。
en_tdlr: This paper discusses the existence of Berk-Nash equilibrium in misspecified Markov Decision Processes, and extends it to cases with compact action spaces and sigma-compact state spaces, addressing the limitations of the Esponda-Pouzo existence theorem in continuous state or action spaces.
